intro: Oldenlandia corymbosa var. linearis, commonly known as the linear oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a herb or shrub, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are often visited by insects, contributing to its ecological role in pollination. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
